title: [ENH] Kalman Filter Forecaster

labels.name: interfacing algorithms
labels.description: Interfacing existing algorithms/estimators for other packages

body:
### Description
The Kalman Filter is an algorithm consisting of several mathematical equations that estimate the states of a process.
The Kalman Filter can support estimations of past, present, and future states.
The strength of the Kalman Filter is in its ability to efficiently infer the state of a system, even when its exact nature is unknown.
For more information about Kalman Filter, [see](https://www.cs.unc.edu/~welch/media/pdf/kalman_intro.pdf). 

**_Kalman Filter can be used as a transformer (smoothing)_** 
Estimate the series of unobserved states -  $x_t$  for  $t=1,2,...,n$ 
When given input data measurements -  $m_t$  for $t=1,2,...,n$
related issue -  https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/1011

**_Kalman Filter can be used as a forecaster_**  
Estimate the series of **future** states -  $x_t$  for $t=n+1, n+2, ..., n+fh$  
When given input data measurements -  $m_t$  for $t=1,2,...,n$,  and $forecast-horizon - fh$  
[Forecasting with Kalman Filter](https://www.stat.pitt.edu/stoffer/dss_files/em.pdf). 

### Feature Request
Implementation of a Kalman Filter Forecaster.

### Implementation suggestion 
Forecasting with Kalman Filter will be a two steps process -

1.  _Transforming the input data measurements_

The last transformed data measurement (`x_transformed[-1]`) will be used in step 2.
Data transformation can be done by using `sktime`’s KalmanFilterTransformer.  

2.  _Predict_ 

Implement the Kalman filter’s predict equation (simple mathematical equation), and use it to calculate the results iteratively.
